reasoning: Based on the provided project structure and initial findings, the project consists of a Python backend file (`main.py`), an HTML frontend file (`index.html`), and two configuration/utility text files (`.cursorignore`, `.cursorrules`). The initial findings highlight expertise needed in backend development (Python Flask), frontend structure (HTML), and understanding project configuration/metadata. To effectively analyze these files, a team of three specialized agents is proposed: one for backend logic, one for frontend presentation, and one for handling configuration and ignore rules. This team size is within the requested range of 3-5 and covers all distinct file types present. Files are assigned to agents based on the primary technology or purpose of the file.

agent_1.name: Backend Agent
agent_1.description: Specialized in analyzing Python code, backend logic, server-side frameworks like Flask, and API implementations.

agent_2.name: Frontend Agent
agent_2.description: Specialized in analyzing HTML structure, web page layout, frontend technologies, and templating.

agent_3.name: Config Agent
